titles.title: Säyfä mäläkot “Sword of Divinity” / Ǝgziʾabǝḥer zä-bǝrhanat ʾǝgziʾabǝḥer zä-śǝlṭanat... “God of Lights, God of Powers...” / Ḥaḍurä mäsqäl “Rampart of the Cross”

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Säyfä mäläkot “Sword of Divinity” (fols. 2r-5v) II) Ǝgziʾabǝḥer zä-bǝrhanat ʾǝgziʾabǝḥer zä-śǝlṭanat... “God of Lights, God of Powers...” (Prayer to Lord) (fols. 6r-8v, 53r) III) Ḥaḍurä mäsqäl “Rampart of the Cross” (fols. 9r-52v)
Additiones 1-2.

donors.donor: The name of the original donor has been erased from some of the supplication formulas. Possibly the name was Täklä Haymanot (fols. 7v, 12v, 46v), written also interlineally (fols. 8r, 9v, 35r, 49r, 52v), or <...> Maryam (fol. 37r). They might have been replaced with still another name written interlineally and also erased; on fols. 46v and 49v, this name can be identified as Täklä Ṣǝge.

txstates.txstate: The front board is broken and repaired with different threads. The sewing is slightly damaged. Several fols. are affected by humidity.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (the front board broken and repaired). Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Holes are visible in the centre fold of the quires, close to the tail and the head of the codex.

squires.squire: I(8/fols. 1r-8v) – II(8/fols. 9r-16v) – ፪III(8/fols. 17r-24v) – ፫IV(8/fols. 25r-32v) – ፬V(8/fols. 33r-40v) – ፭VI(8/fols. 41r-48v) – ፮VII(7; s.l.: 3, stub after 5/fols. 45r-53v).

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. Structural pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rulings.ruling: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. Structural pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: The handwriting is uniform and remains rather regular throughout the Ms. Some distinctive features: - right-sloping letters - ዕ, in the 6th order, is angular, pointed downwards (e.g., fols. 38r l.3, 37r l.2) - ኴ has the loop of the 5th order marker open (fol. 47r l.5) - ፬ is triangular, downwards-oriented (e.g., quire mark fol. 33r); - ፮ has the loop open, looking like “compressed” ፯ (e.g., quire mark fol. 49r and 33v l.13). - ፪ has angular loops (e.g., quire mark fol. 17r) - ligature of ሌ and ሉ in the word ሃሌ፡ ሉያ፡ (fol. 12v l.6).

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; name of the donor(s); first line in the incipit of Texts I and III and first word in the incipit of Text II; the initial word of some sections of Text I (fols. 3r, 5r); Trinitarian formula (or part of it); the words mäsqäl (and its abbreviation) and ʾaganǝnt (fol. 27r); some words written interlineally (e.g., fol. 52v); elements of the punctuation signs and the text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

abbreviations.abbreviation: አሜ፡ for አሜን፡ (fol. 5r l.14). መ፡/መስ፡ for መስቀል፡ (e.g., fols. 12r, 29v, 38r) ሰ፡ for ሰላም፡ (fols. 38r-38v) አሜ፡ for አሜን፡ (fol. 35r l.1) አ፡ for አሜን፡ (fol. 45r l.4).

otherdetails.otherdetail:
Text I: - Cp. the text in S. GREBAUT, “La prière Sayfa malakot”, Aethiopica 4 (1936), 1-6). Cp. also Ms. JRyM 22, fols. 31r-40v (StrJRyM 65). Text II: - Cp. “Ǝgziʾabǝḥer zä-bǝrhanat”, EAE II, 249, and ChRep 349, no. 363. - The text is interrupted on fol. 8v, and continues on fol. 53r. On fol. 8v, the text ends with the words: ሀሎ፡ በተፍጻሜቱ፨ “(the writing) is at the end” (written in a frame). The text is introduced on fol. 53r by the words: ዝኒ፡ ዘተረፈ “This is what remains”. Text III: - Cp. the text in D. LIFCHITZ, Textes éthiopiens magico-religieux, Paris 1940 (Travaux et Mémoires de l’Institut d’Ethnologie 38), 92-146. It is the version (incipit: በስመ፡’’… አአትብ፡ ገጽየ፡ ወእትነሣእ፡ በስመ፡ ፫አስማት፡ ነሢእየ፡ እትመረጐዝ፡…) which should not be confused with the text “Prayer for the Rampart of the Cross” (incipit: ጸሎተ፡ በእንተ፡ ሐፁረ፡ መስቀል፡ ዘጸሐፈ፡ ኤርምያስ፡ ነቢይ፡…; cp. S. GREBAUT, “Litanies de la Croix”, Aethiopica 4 (1935), 187-90). Cp. also “Ḥaṣurä mäsqäl”, EAE II, 1045-46.
Some supplication formulas are dedicated to an individual for whom the first person, with the word እገሌ “certain”, is used: አነ፡ ገብርከ፡ እገሌ፡ (fol. 21v) ሊተ፡ ለገብርከ፡ እገሌ፡ (e.g., fols. 19v, 23v).

additional.cont: Fol. 52v: ˀAsmat-prayer.
additional.add: Fol. 52v: ዮፍታሄ፡ ቱላሜሄ፡… በአስማተ፡ ዝንቱ፡ ስምከ፡…

additional.cont: Fols. 53v-55v: Protective prayer against thieves and robbers.
additional.add: Fol. 53v: በሚካኤል፡ መልአክ፡ አፍዝዝ፡… ወለነጣቂ፡…
additional.det: Written in Amharic and Gǝʿǝz. The name of the person to whom they are dedicated (probably Täklä Haymanot) has been erased from the supplication formulas.

extras.extra: - The letters መ and መስ, abbreviations of the word መስቀል, and the word እገሌ (s. above “Other details”) are marked with black and red dashes below and above throughout the Ms.; the same is for a single sentence in fol. 35r (with lines below and above). - Cues for the rubricator: fols. 12v and 27r. - Corrections (words or letters) written interlineally: fols. 2v, 4v, 6v, 8v, 23r, 29r, 30r, 38v, 50r, 52v. - Writing exercises in the upper margin of fol. 54r. - A note ዛቲ[፡] መጽሐፍ is written in red ink on fol. 1v (in the frame of the miniature). - A note ዝአብነት፡ ፍቱን፡ (?) is written in the upper margin of fol. 54v (same hand as Additio 2?). - Pen trial: fol. 1v. - Doodles: fols. 1r, 55v, 55v, 55r.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: Undecorated quire marks are written in the left upper margin of the first fol. of quires III-VII: fol. 17r: ፪; fol. 25r: ፫; fol. 33r: ፬; fol. 41r: ፭; fol. 45r: ፮.
